column1: It  is  important  to  note  that  in  this  case,  manifestly  inconsistent  evidence  of  all  the  prosecution
witnesses has not established a prima facie case against the accused-appellant.
The prosecution has failed to prove its case beyond reasonable doubt and that the conviction and
the sentence imposed on the accused-appellant cannot stand.
Therefore, the accused-appellant is acquitted and discharged from the charge against him.
The registrar of this court is directed to send a copy of this judgement along with the main case
record to the High Court of Gampaha.
The learned High Court Judge of Gampaha is directed to recall the arrest warrant issued against the
accused-appellant forthwith. The prison authorities should also be informed of the decision of this
